title: Call for Applications: Internet and Society Fellowship 2026
content: The Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society (HIIG) is opening its doors to new fellows in 2026! The post Call for Applications: Internet and Society Fellowship 2026 appeared first on HIIG .
creator: Judith Beyer

title: Impactful by design: For digital entrepreneurs driven to create positive societal impact

title: Identifying bias, taking responsibility: Critical perspectives on AI and data quality in higher education
content: AI is changing higher education. This article explores the risks of bias and why we need a critical approach. The post Identifying bias, taking responsibility: Critical perspectives on AI and data quality in higher education appeared first on HIIG .

title: Who spreads disinformation, where, for what purpose, and to what extent?
content: How much disinformation do German politicians and parties actually spread? On which platforms and to what ends? Two new studies provide systematic answers. The post Who spreads disinformation, where, for what purpose, and to what extent? appeared first on HIIG .
creator: Digital Society Blog

title: Inside content moderation: Humans, machines and invisible work
content: Content moderation combines human labour and algorithmic systems, exposing global inequalities in who controls what we see online. The post Inside content moderation: Humans, machines and invisible work appeared first on HIIG .
creator: Digital Society Blog
sourceDescription: Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society

title: Senior Researcher (m/f/d): Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Society
content: Important note: We are no longer accepting applications for this position. The Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society (HIIG) is seeking a postdoctoral researcher to coordinate and further develop its new research focus on “Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Society”. The application process is conducted in German. The review of applications will begin on 10… The post Senior Researcher (m/f/d): Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Society appeared first on HIIG .
creator: Frederik Efferenn
sourceDescription: Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society

title: Beyond Big Tech: National strategies for platform alternatives
content: China, Russia and India are building national platform alternatives to reduce their dependence on Big Tech. What can Europe learn from their strategies? The post Beyond Big Tech: National strategies for platform alternatives appeared first on HIIG .
creator: Digital Society Blog
sourceDescription: Alexander von Humboldt Institute for Internet and Society

title: Three foundations are supporting digitalisation research at HIIG: With a focus on democratic change, the future of law, entrepreneurship and society
content: HIIG receives funding from three foundations to advance digitalisation research on democracy, technology, law, innovation, and AI. The post Three foundations are supporting digitalisation research at HIIG: With a focus on democratic change, the future of law, entrepreneurship and society appeared first on HIIG .
